data.text:
Really? Jadeja over Ashwin? Say it ain't so...

I recently swapped, despite not being a fan of Jadeja's batting. Think he is the slightly more valuable player in Asia because that's where his batting really is all-rounder level, and their bowling is very close there as Jadeja's left arm angle is completely lethal on turning wickets. Ashwin is definitely the better bowler outside Asia but on resume the gap isn't big enough considering Jadeja's better batting and slightly better overall value in Asia. There's a reason they play Jadeja in SENA.

I voted Inzamam anyway. For all his problems on fast pitches he did a fair bit more overseas than Jadeja; and while Jadeja is indispensable in Asia, Inzy will still win me some games there.

Think both are slightly overrated but Jadeja has managed an inflated bowling average and a very inflated batting average. Nobody thinks he's a sub-25 bowler but the fat in his batting returns go under the radar. Think he's Pollock level at best and with probably a more linked range. Has hardly anything worth talking about outside Asia.

He's pretty much only faced high quality attacks and has scored runs just about everywhere he has gone in an era of pretty sporty wickets. His numbers might take a bit of a ding if he had played every away test (whether or not those games were low scoring, due to being better at home), but he is still averaging in the Imran/Miller range away.
